author: wtopstaff
title: New York Mets Postseason History
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » New York Mets Postseason History New York Mets Postseason History By The Associated Press  22 pm 
The postseason history of the New York Mets: World Series (Won 2, Lost 2) 
2000 — Lost to New York Yankees, 4-1 
1986 — Beat Boston Red Sox, 4-3 
1973 — Lost to Oakland A’s, 4-3 
1969 — Beat Baltimore Orioles, 4-1 
Record — Won 12, Lost 12 League Championship Series (Won 4, Lost 3) 
2006 — Lost to St. Louis Cardinals, 4-3 
2000 — Beat St. Louis Cardinals, 4-1 
1999 — Lost to Atlanta Braves, 4-2 
1988 — Lost to Los Angeles Dodgers, 4-3 
1986 — Beat Houston Astros, 4-2 
1973 — Beat Cincinnati Reds, 3-2 
1969 — Beat Atlanta Braves, 3-0 
Record — Won 22, Lost 17 Divisional Playoff Series (Won 4, Lost 0) 
2015 — Beat Los Angeles Dodgers, 3-2 
2006 — Beat Los Angeles Dodgers, 3-0 
2000 — Beat San Francisco Giants, 3-1 
1999 — Beat Arizona Diamondbacks, 3-1 
Record — Won 12, Lost 4 Topics:
